since_last_update: US risk tone improved mid-week as Trump cooled/paused Greenland-related tariff threats and described a framework with NATO; this reduced immediate trade/geopolitical risk premia after earlier volatility, but follow-through is fragile because details remain unsettled (AP, Yahoo/Finance; Forbes).
Tech/AI-beta sentiment took a hit into Friday’s open after Intel’s results: headline beat but guidance disappointed, weighing Nasdaq futures relative to broader ES (Barron’s; Yahoo/Finance; IBD).

Global macro impulse turned mixed: Eurozone flash PMIs leaned softer on services/composite (growth down / rates-bid impulse), while UK data (retail sales + composite PMI) surprised stronger, pushing UK rate-cut expectations back and leaning global yields modestly higher at the margin (FT).

Oil-specific: EIA inventory data showed large crude + distillate builds (per provided NEW info), a bearish impulse for crude/energy equities that can modestly ease headline-inflation fears (second-order supportive for duration) if sustained (LOCAL).
today_focus: Dominant driver check: 'event-risk + rates sensitivity' remains the main tape lever—markets are positioning around incoming US high-frequency activity data (S&P Global flash PMIs) and sentiment/inflation expectations; this matters most for NQ via real-rate/duration sensitivity (Barron’s; IBD; FXStreet).

Earnings as the session-level mover: Intel-guidance disappointment is the clearest single-name macro proxy (AI/server demand narrative) that can spill into semis and Nasdaq leadership breadth (Barron’s; Yahoo/Finance).

Geopolitics/policy risk premium is still a live overhang: Greenland/tariff rhetoric de-escalated, but the lack of finalized agreement keeps headline-gap risk elevated into the weekend (AP; Yahoo/Finance).

Gold bid appears to be tracking 'risk premium + real-yield/dollar mix' rather than a single macro print; watch whether gold strength coincides with stable-to-lower yields (risk-off hedge demand) versus higher yields (tighter financial conditions signal) (Barron’s; AP).

market_pricing.dominant_narrative: Cross-currents: earnings-led Nasdaq fragility (Intel) + policy/geopolitical headline risk (Greenland/tariffs) + near-term US data risk (flash PMIs) driving rate-sensitive positioning.

what_is_priced: Two-day relief bounce largely reflects reduced immediate tariff escalation odds, but with 'headline gap' risk still priced as residual volatility rather than fully removed (AP; Yahoo/Finance).
Nasdaq leadership is being treated as more earnings/AI-demand sensitive than the broader tape today (Intel as the catalyst) (Barron’s; IBD).
what_may_be_underpriced: Nonlinear drawdown risk if 'policy risk' re-escalates abruptly (weekend headline gap) while positioning has rotated back toward risk after the relief rally (AP).
Correlation risk: if PMIs come in inflationary (prices paid) and push yields up, NQ downside can be amplified even without a broad earnings shock (inference; FXStreet timing focus on PMIs).

what_is_priced: Market is treating today’s PMIs as the next near-term catalyst to tilt the growth-vs-inflation balance; any surprise can quickly transmit through real rates into equities (IBD; FXStreet).
what_may_be_underpriced: Rates-vol spillover from overseas: UK 'less easing' repricing can tug global yields higher, tightening financial conditions at the margin for US duration assets (inference; FT).

what_is_priced: Gold is acting as a risk hedge into uncertain policy/geopolitical headlines and late-week positioning (AP; Barron’s).
Crude remains vulnerable to inventory-driven supply/demand signals after the large EIA build surprise (LOCAL).
what_may_be_underpriced: If crude weakness persists, second-round effects could appear via energy credit/energy-equity capex expectations (risk-off) even as headline inflation fear eases (inference; LOCAL).

risk_register.risk: US flash PMIs deliver 'hot prices/firm activity' mix -> yields/real rates up -> NQ underperforms via duration channel
Greenland/tariff headline gap re-opens (weekend or off-hours), re-widening risk premia and supporting gold while pressuring ES/NQ
Earnings landmines broaden beyond Intel (AI/semis guidance, mega-cap read-through) causing index-level de-risking
Cross-asset adverse mix: equities soften while yields rise (tightening financial conditions) rather than the 'risk-off = yields down' cushion
Energy shock variant: persistent inventory builds -> oil down -> energy equities/credit underperform -> broader cyclicals sentiment drag

event_warnings: Jan 23: US S&P Global flash Manufacturing & Services PMIs (high sensitivity to both activity and 'prices' components; can move rates + NQ quickly) (FXStreet; IBD).
Jan 23: University of Michigan revised sentiment + inflation expectations (watch inflation-expectations revision for real-rate impulse) (IBD).
Ongoing: policy/geopolitical headlines around Greenland/NATO/tariffs remain a high-variance, low-forecastability catalyst; treat weekend as elevated gap-risk window (AP; Yahoo/Finance).
